website_summaries.verdict: While it's expensive and still a work in progress, UE's Blast speaker is one of the best sounding portable Alexa-enabled speakers.
pros: The UE Blast is a compact, fully waterproof Wi-Fi and Bluetooth speaker that has Amazon's Alexa voice assistant built in
It sounds good for its small size, is durable and offers decent battery life
cons: There's no voice support for Spotify playback (it can only stream Spotify via Bluetooth)
The USB charging port is a little bit of a pain to access, making the optional charging base more of a must-have accessory for home use

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple months ago. Used it a half a dozen times and was very happy with it. Then about a month ago I tried turning it on and it would not switch on. I thought the battery may be dead, so I plugged it up to the charger... All the lights lit up like it was charging correctly. After a day's worth of charging I tried turning it on... No luck. I don't know if it's a switch issue or what, but it's dead and won't revive.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker, poor Alexa and additional features
customer_reviews.text: The speaker itself, great. The rest -meh. The Alexa piece of this is poor functionally. The mic to pick up works with no music playing, but even at a medium volume it can’t pick up you’re voice unless you go right up to it. I also haven’t figured out the WiFi piece of this. I’ll play music, through Alexa, yetbit still seems to play from my phone via Bluetooth. If I walk too far the music cuts out as Bluetooth typically would. I would recommend getting the regular ua speaker as they are great, for just a speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew  Harnden

customer_reviews.title: PURE JUNK..SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: SAVE YOUR MONEY....It sounds OK as a bluetooth speaker but as an Alexa speaker, it constantly drops the wi-fi and leaves you with a deaf, dumb and mute Alexa imposter. Oh, and it does not support Spotify and is unaware of other Alexa devices on your account. This is real POS and desperately in need of a firmware update to at least address the flakey Wi-fi but I am guessing this is no longer supported by logitech since it hasn't already been addressed despite numerous negative reviews. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have always been extremely happy w/ UE products. We loved the Blast speaker until it stopped working. It was purchased as a Mother's Day gift for my wife (which we gave to her early) but after less than 1 month of use it will no longer power on. Now it's just a very expensive paper weight. Hopefully it is covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: love it, this thing is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Stripped down version of the UE BOOM. I have the UE BOOM, love it, this thing is a joke. No party mode?? No 1/8" analog cable plug? Oh, yeah, I get Alexa!! If you own one, set up wireless, , not BlueTooth, and update the firmware, they don't tell you the firmware installed on these is flawed. Bluetooth won't stay connected till you get the lashes FW. Is there a model that does Alexa AND party mode???
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: No play/pause or forward/backward buttons, and Alexa cannot play/pause/forward/backward a bluetooth device.
customer_reviews.text: There is no pause button. You can ask Alexa to pause music that he's playing through the internet, but there is no way to play/pause while on bluetooth except to use your device to do it manually. Great music quality! But for the price, you'd expect basic features, like a play/pause button, and forward/backward buttons, or at least integrate alexa to work with devices connected via bluetooth. If this device's crowning jewel is it's Alexa connectivity with voice commands, then Alexa should be able to pause music over bluetooth like any other dumb speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: It quit powering up after one month bbn of use
customer_reviews.text: I have h.g as the UE Blast for one month and seven days, 7 days past the authorized return date. On as bout the 3rd of June it stopped powering up. I tried to ensure that it was charged I 3 different outlets which are known good power sources, and still it refuses to power. I h.g ad a UE Boom for 3 years and h.g ave never had an issue. I like t h.g e scv ound. All I want tut o do is swap it out. I have seen other customer comments regarding the same issue. What is the problem here. I don't recommend buying one until this issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Freeda J, Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Stops playing every 10-20 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Would love to listen to music without it turning off every 10-20 minutes. It’s not relaxing when you have to remind it to keep playing! I’ve used the app to be sure it’s not something in the settings like a timer. Nope, it should work properly but doesn’t and unfortunately I can’t return it or I would!! Bought in April and this started in June and I was in the middle of moving and wasn’t able to get this handled, now it’s too late and I’m stuck with babysitting the speaker! Sound is great I just wished it played longer than 10-20 minutes at a time and I didn’t have to keep telling it to continue to play.
customer_reviews.author: crybott

customer_reviews.title: Not so good with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Flash sale at amazon, got it for $80. Good for the price but if you plan to sync multiples speakers stuck with the boom once the blast doesn’t do it. The Alexa doesn’t work as any amazon Alexa device, you have to yell for commands, not compatible with a lot of apps, specially Spotify. Conclusion: if you planning to pay full price get the boom 2, if you’re buying because of Alexa don’t buy this speaker, I end up connecting my amazon echo to my blast and works way better that way.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny Lopes

customer_reviews.title: QUIT WORKING AFTER ONE WEEK OF USE.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a week then all of a sudden quit working. Will not power on. Nothing. Tried charging it on the base that I purchased separately, charged it directly. Still nothing. Have no idea what happened that it doesn't work at all. It was a gift and now I can't return it because its been over a month. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Speaker, But Amazon Alexa Compatibility a Bust!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because it was an Amazon special lightning deal. The speaker is loud and paired without too much trouble, but it's Amazon Alexa compatibility has never worked. That's the whole reason I pulled the trigger, to get voice control, but the Alexa pairing is a bust. Wouldn't have bought it had a known better. Tried contacting manufacturer customer service, but that was a nightmare also. I hate when I get suckered into a Lightning Deal on a Lame Product.
customer_reviews.author: My $.03

customer_reviews.title: It works fine as a bluetooth speaker, but the wi-fi weakness is a deal breaker at full price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these up front on a deal-of-the-day. Both have problems dropping wi-fi strength and losing the audio stream. They just seem to susceptible to wi-fi interference. My phone works much better. I have the same problem sometimes with the Alexa functions -- it just sits quietly sometimes trying to get a connection and then fails too often. It works fine as a bluetooth speaker, but the wi-fi weakness is a deal breaker at full price. Lucky I bought it at a big discount.
customer_reviews.author: JohnB

customer_reviews.title: Both WiFi and Bluetooth constantly connects and disconnects.  Horrible, don't bother with this junk.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this speaker for almost a year and have had connection problems from the start. Lately the problems seem to be getting worst. It is the only Bluetooth device that I have that constantly loses connection. The WiFi connection was much more reliable but nowadays it is also intermittent. At times I want to throw it against the wall. When it works it does sound good, but it is not worth the hassle. The first and last product I but from this company. I also find the stupid conga sound when turning on/off very annoying. You cannot turn it off. Avoid this product like the plague. I simply hate it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Unit -- - -- And...It's Stereo!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, the presence was a little overbearing. After a few hours of higher volume playing, the speakers are broken in and the presence is right on. Am enjoying all the many attributes of this unit. A definite keeper, especially at $99. The fact that my Blast is a stereo was a pleasant surprise. Naturally the separation isn't dramatic as with a linear system. Nevertheless, the fullness that stereo provides is there. To be sure it indeed is a stereo unit, played Dueling Banjos from Deliverance. 'Tis... Would recommend to a friend at the $99 price point - the going price is a bit presumptuous.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Blast wont turn on after little use...
customer_reviews.text: I got this product back in April and I liked the sound it produced. I only used it maybe a dozen or so times and it was fine. Yesterday, Sept. 9/18 I was listening and the output was choppy at regular intervals it sounded like a skipping record or small pause. Then the red light went on and I was charging while listening. Hours later when I tried to turn on the device it will not turn on at all. I thought maybe I used a charging cable that has to much amperage, but the white light near the charging port is solid, not blinking, so it appears that the battery is charged. It just wont turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Echo integration spotty
customer_reviews.text: Right now this gets a 2 star review. Sound is ok, don't expect a lot at higher volumes or a lot of base, but the sound is very loud at mid-levels. However the Alexa integration is spotty at best...go ahead and ask it to make a phone call or play music from a source other than Amazon. I tried linking my pandora account but all other music sources besides Amazon Music are grayed out (not surprised). I wanted so bad for this awesome speaker to have Amazon Echo capabilities but it's just not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: Alexa streaming pauses non-stop
customer_reviews.text: Would have been better off waiting to do this right. The Alexa integration is a total fail. Bought mine from a T-Mobile sale because I thought they sold decent products. Then later had issues with Alexa playing a full song without constant pauses. What’s the point of digital music if it sounds like it is a scratched CD!? overpriced Bluetooth speaker at this point. It sounds good... but it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: HandyDude

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year, almost to the day.  :(
customer_reviews.text: What a shame. I absolutely loved this speaker! Purchased March 17, 2019. DEAD March 20, 2020. Just will not work. Appears to charge, will turn on, absolutely zero response. One year out of the speaker is not enough. Very disappointed. I used my Amazon dots in most rooms, this was an extra in my bedroom, so it did not get much use. Amazon said contact the seller. With everything going on in this world, I just truly do not have the energy right now. Honestly, this just stinks. :(
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Roosa

customer_reviews.title: The sound isn't too bad giving the size of the speaker
customer_reviews.text: The sound isn't too bad giving the size of the speaker. I would've like it better with a slightly better bass. Also the box says 12hr of play time and doesn't live up to it. It was just at 100% and I've been using it on full volume for a lil less than a 1/2 hour and the battery drained to 60% already. If they can give an update that'll fix those things I just mentioned I would gladly give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nino360adr

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: Got a blue one as a gift. Use it exclusively for TV watching. Have hearing issues and am simply amazed that I place it two feet from my right ear and the sound appears to come from the TV about ten feet in front of me. Also note that this is the first Bluetooth device where I don't notice any small delay between picture and sound (others were earphones). Haven't had it long enough to see any life expectancy issues, but I have just ordered the charging dock as it ran out of power in the middle of a movie after about 6 - 8 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 1 Hour
customer_reviews.text: I have had this speaker for a little over a year and it has never lasted 12 hours or anywhere near it. The sad part is I didn't think anything of it because I've seen manufacturers post units life and it be a bit shorter. It wasn't until I saw what I thought wew far inferior/ heaper speakers lasting through our 2 hr community rides while mine struggle halfway through EVERY time with that "uh low charge moan* it makes that I thought id say something. Wish I hadn't missed that return window. I wanted so badly for this to be better because I was considering the wundedboom but not if this is the MO.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Pairs occasionally with your device, fewer Alexa features than my light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Best in class sound. I had a UE boom for 5 years and took it all over the world. Was hoping for an alternative with Alexa to read my flash briefings and books, but the Alexa features don't work at all. That's not why I'm giving it one star though. Despite all troubleshooting (I'm a tech professional), connectivity constantly drops with latest iPhones, Samsung phones, iPad and high end windows laptop. I wish I hadn't bought this and want to get another original Ue boom, which never failed to connect and in case it did I could use the headphone jack and still listen.
customer_reviews.author: Taysnew

customer_reviews.title: Previously opened and defective.
customer_reviews.text: The tape on the box was open when we received it, and the plastic covering the speaker was very wrinkled like it was previously opened. The speaker would not connect to Bluetooth. It was obviously opened and resent out, even though it was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Alexa Tap replacement
customer_reviews.text: My Alexa Tap was dying and the Ultimate Ears BLAST was the best replacement that I could find. Pros: 1. Better sound than the Tap. 2. It has extended battery life over the Tap. 3. It is waterproof. You can’t beat that. Cons: 1.it does not work like a tap with a button. 2. You can’t change the activation name from Alexa to Echo or the other names that Echo devices support.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Nicol

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for defective products
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father after having multiple Logitech speakers such as the Gen 1 Megaboom, boom 2, and S715i. All of which have performed wonderfully and are still going strong. which brings me to the blast This product out of the box cuts in and out of audio and experiences a large amount of ear crunching distortion. assuming this was a software problem that probably had been patched I updated the software and Factory reset the device and the problem remains still. The quality control that Logitech brings to its other products is not here and you would be better served to buy the Boom which has considerably better battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Saferstein

customer_reviews.title: It has deep rich sound and holds a good charge. The Alexa part functions well
customer_reviews.text: So Far it has been a BLAST to use this speaker. It has deep rich sound and holds a good charge. The Alexa part functions well. It could use some upgrades on voice recognition (e.g.if music is playing at a good volume Alexa will not hear your commands. The reviews about the music being distorted at max volume are true but most any speaker will distort at max volume. If you need that much more volume for say a large party then buy the MEGABLAST.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I only occasionally used this product as a speaker in my garage when working out and it has now completely stopped working and will no longer power on. It’s supposed to be durable but it’s never been exposed to water or even direct sunlight and still completely died out after a year and a half of very light use. When I bought this back in 2018 I paid over $100 for it - disappointed in this purchase to say the very least
customer_reviews.author: bitterBuffalow

customer_reviews.title: - Love the look
customer_reviews.text: Got a few of these blue ones. PROS: - Love the look, super stylish and the color is beautiful - Easy to set up and intuitive to use - Nice huge buttons - Waterproof - Good sound CONS: - Alexa is spotty at best - No ability to turn off remotely
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Sound ok...hardware is junk
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that this only lasted 2 months (light use) and it died. Will not turn on. When it was working, internet connection was spotty. It would constantly disconnect then reconnect while playing Amazon Music. Bluetooth connections were the same thing. Alexa? Sometimes worked, sometimes didn't. It was the reason I bought the Blast. I'm back to using my Bose Soundlink Mini (incredible speaker!!!). Way better sound and the bluetooth connection is always solid.
customer_reviews.author: Donatello

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Being an owner of Ultimate Ear's Boom 2 speaker and loving it, I had high hopes for the new and improved version. I almost didn't order it based on the bad reviews, but I'm glad I did. So far the speaker has been fantastic. Great sound quality (it's a bit crisper than the Boom 2), sleek looks, and is supports streaming via Alexa and Spotify. Overall, impressed.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Good for treble, meh for bass.
customer_reviews.text: You need wi-fi for the set-up. You can still use it without wi-fi, but you can't mess with thr equalizer at all. The equalizer is interesting but I can't say I hear much of a difference. I give this a 4 star because while this speaker is good for country/rock/anything treble focused, I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who likes to listen to bass heavy songs. It gets pretty loud and the sound holds up pretty well except for the loudest parts of songs, but part of me can't tell if it's the speaker quality or if it's just how loud the music is.
customer_reviews.author: Mickael

customer_reviews.title: Its our go too speaker for everything
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love these. They sound amazing and with Alexa built in, they are just too convenient not to use the heck out of it. The battery lasts a long time, the sound quality is awesome and if youbturn it way up, it still sounds perfectly clear. We loved it so much, qe bought another one just so qe didn't have to fight for it all the time. I would recommend the charging dock, it works by simply setting it down on the dock and it plays while charging. With the dock adapter on the bottom, it stays completely waterproof without having to do anything after charging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Felt like a downgrade from the original UE boom
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning. Variable response (aka inconsistent and on erred on the not usual side) for the Alexa component. Often had fuzzy playback even when nearby and difficulty connecting. Disapponted that there wasn’t an app to turn off/on with like the other ue boom categories which is what I was looking for. Ended up going back to the classic UE Boom
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: great speaker with the capability to have Alexa built in.
customer_reviews.text: i like having Alexa and a speaker in one. I did not realize it would also work with my iphone. But now that I know, that is a real bonus. The sound is good. It switches easily from my home wifi to my work wifi without resetting it. It is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One I had purchased previously and it still works. This one didn't play but about 3 times and would keep dying even then. I'm not impressed whatsoever. Go to ebay and buy one much cheaper if you are going to try it. No sense in paying much for it.
customer_reviews.author: Vonda Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this Product
customer_reviews.text: No regrets purchasing. The sound is amazing. I use it camping, at the pool and on the boat. It connects easily to my phone and generally stays connected. The connectivity with Alexa is not the best, hopefully they will make some updates to improve that service.
customer_reviews.author: S. Zinn

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound wasn’t the best in this one
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good speaker and it’s pretty loud, however the one I got had a lot of static, the voice of the songs was very blurry, like I could not go higher than 7 because it was hard to undersnaird the songs. I have a US BOOM 2 and I compared them together and the BOOM 2 sounded way better, I returned this item and asked for a replacement hoping that I’ll get a better one. Overall the brand and product is great but I guess I got bad luck with this one this time!
customer_reviews.author: Ever Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speaker indestructible devices  Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my children each one of these for Christmas and they love them to death so I bought myself one. Sounds great, love the Alexa compatibility can’t say enough good things about it though the charging base is a tad expensive. One no it does not interface with echo products Alexa. It would be a great improvement if they would allow it a.k.a. Amazon to stream with other Alexa devices
customer_reviews.author: *C*A*D*

customer_reviews.title: Sounds better than Tap, but doesn't listen as well
customer_reviews.text: The sound this speaker produces is incredible! It's significantly louder than the Amazon Tap, which perhaps justifies its higher cost. It feels very well-made, and looks fantastic. I haven't tested just how waterproof it is, but it certainly hasn't had any issues with the small amount of water I've exposed it to. My biggest gripe is that the microphone is terrible. It fails to respond quite often, even when I'm very close.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died within a few months
customer_reviews.text: I liked this speaker while it lasted, but it stopped working after about 4 months. I only used it a few times around the house and it suddenly refused to charge or turn on at all. I tried resetting it and using the diagnostic tool, but I couldn't even get my computer to recognize it. This is the second time I've had a UE product fail shortly after purchasing it, so I think I'll be staying away from them in the future. If you want a bluetooth speaker that will actually work for more than a few months, try the Fugoo Style; I've had one for over three years and had zero issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Waste. Get boom 2.
customer_reviews.text: Literally just bought this for the speaker, which on it's own failed miserably. Every other song it would randomly skip 1-2 seconds and it had nothing to do with the wifi or bluetooth connection, it was literally like when you're in a car and drive over a bump and your cd skips... annoying, returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker, it is super clear, and I mean extremely clear! It gets really loud and has deep bass after breaking in the speakers. Also the 360 degree sound is amazing, it fills the whole room with sound no matter where it is placed. The battery is also very good for how small it is. Overall you won't be disappointed with this speaker, highly recommend buying this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but pauses on stream.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound when working. Streaming at times there are gaps or pauses that are not a product of WiFi or Bluetooth connections. As well on streaming from Amazon music it stops after each song, but if I just play from my phone it continuously plays.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Devin De Marr

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first but then never worked again
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this product, it was great. worked well and was easy to connect. But when the battery went died, I could not get it to charge again. I even bought the fancier charger station without success. Then I searched for others having same issues and of course, found a lot. There is even a diagnostic tool to try to fix this issue but I can't even get the PC to find the device to get the tool to work. I gave up and am just going to throw it way. Expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth speaker, decent Alexa device. The mic is just so weak that you have to yell at it unless you’re in a totally quiet room. Sound is very good, though it sounds like it’s gonna pop above about 80%. I would keep it at about 70% max for best sound clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Robert CC Smith

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge
customer_reviews.text: A frustrating purchase; the speaker almost immediately had issues with charging. Sometimes it would hold a charge and other times it would be dead as soon as you removed it from the charger. It stopped working altogether after less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is broken
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Blast a few months after getting it on a deal. Now the Alexa feature is broken. I have completed the factory reset as the company says to and it still does not work. It will stop in the middle of playing a song or a news update for no reason. The alexa option on this was a big draw for me because I already had bluetooth speakers and this was a nice portable alexa option. Now, I just have yet another bluetooth speaker. It is very frustrating and I would caution anyone against buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Kortney

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't but this crappy product. It really sucks. Tried for days to have it play consitently over WiFi, and it always stops working after some random time. One reason was when my Ring camera detected motion. Not sure why this would be. But it never played music for more than 30 minutes without stopping. It looks cool, and sounded okay, but my 5 year old Bluetooth speaker I was looking to replace never had any issues like this. Firmware was up to date so it's just broken. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Holtam

customer_reviews.title: Buy a new one...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished model: No charger, no instruction manual and it took FOREVER to sync to my WiFi network. :( Also, it won’t play Apple Music through this speaker even with the Amazon skill enabled. :(
customer_reviews.author: Gman4Real

customer_reviews.title: Tough, good sounding speaker
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is tough, durable, easy to pack and sounds great. I use mine for camping, cooking out, car speakers temporarily, entertainment for my four year old, and a shower speaker. It's been beaten up and soaked and frozen and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Love ue boom! This is the third one we’ve gotten. Using alexa with it somewhat difficult to figure out and im not sure if its worth the extra money for alexa option. Would have been just fine purchasing non alexa unit. All in all though ue boom continues to impress with sound quality, durability and pairing options with other booms and phone Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jason and Niki

customer_reviews.title: Just spend the $50 more and get the JBL Charge.
customer_reviews.text: Fair to good Bluetooth speaker. Just bite the bullet and pay the extra $50 for the JBL Charge. Sound is fine, volume fine, connection via Bluetooth works most of the time. The metal ring is a great feature for active events like boating or kayaking. Very waterproof. Built well.
customer_reviews.author: thm1075

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Great sound in a small package. This is my first portable speaker and i love it. Range is great when you walk away with your phone in your pocket, the music keeps playing without interruptions. Alexa support is a plus although either I haven't figured out how to send a text message or it doesn't support that function. Either way, Alexa is helpful and sounds great. Its easy to get started and didn't have a problem with the set up. Good bass and treble for a nice all around sound.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: So much is wrong with this product
customer_reviews.text: The charging cradle just does not work. The battery life drains at 3x the speed of previous Booms. Alexa hardly ever works and connections are spotty at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from a speaker the size of a Monster Energy drink can. You can tune the sound through the free app. Simple to use and durable. I Use it with phone and computer Bluetooth. Once it’s set up the first time it’s very easy to connect. Awesome sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Pinelli

customer_reviews.title: but the sound quality is amazing. I have other portable blue tooth speakers but ...
customer_reviews.text: The Alexa integration is so-so , but the sound quality is amazing. I have other portable blue tooth speakers but so far I enjoy the UE blast the most. Mahalo
customer_reviews.author: Keola O

customer_reviews.title: Great Alexa Bluetooth speacker
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how good this one is. I have a number of high quality Bluetooth speakers and this one is the best with Alexa built in. It will go on vacations with me.
customer_reviews.author: Burky

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth and Wifi connections both cut in and out and it never works like it should. It doesn’t have the remote on/off feature like the UE Boom. I’ve tried to contact technical support but always get the run around and no one ever fixes the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Ford

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy refurb
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked for two months and now it won’t hold a charge or turn on. My return window closed so I’m stuck with this hunk of junk. Don’t trust amazon renewed products.
customer_reviews.author: Boss Haus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. nice and loud, looks great. I have not used the alexa capabilities yet.
customer_reviews.author: jodeci78

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof nor water resistant

Do it all at home or on-the-go, even take calls without killing the music whenever connected to Wi-Fi or a mobile hotspot. Blasting 360° bold, immersive, crystal clear sound, this Wi-Fi/Bluetooth speaker will bring your music to life in its full glory wherever you take it. ULTIMATE VOICE CONTROL - Ultimate Ears BLAST comes with hands-free Amazon Alexa built right in. Just ask Alexa to blast tunes, change tracks, crank the volume, check the weather – or try any of Alexa’s crazy skills. Use Alexa anywhere your speaker goes, all you need is Wi-Fi or a mobile hotspot. THE MUSIC NEVER STOPS - Ultimate Ears BLAST brings Wi-Fi to the portable speaker party and connects directly to the cloud. Enjoy fast, seamless music streaming and a bigger range to roam and dance. Anyone can DJ. And even take calls without stopping the music and killing the vibe. SERIOUSLY WATERPROOF AND VIRTUALLY INDESTRUCTIBLE - Ultimate Ears BLAST is drop proof, seriously waterproof, and ready to rock any adventure. From the pool to the all-night beach party, the summer festivals to the winter slopes – your music will always be on point no matter how wild things get.

Connect speakers: Pair up to 8 BLAST and MEGABLAST for more immersive sound or 2 speakers for stereo mode.
